page.title: 08Energy In Bishop Monkton
page.content:
{ { {Electricity.}Electric power is supplied by the North East Electricity Board (NEEB) and practically all dwelliings,farm buildings,and small workshops are equipped.There is street lighting in the village,which is not complete,but which has been extended considerably in recent years. { { {Oil.}Many of newer dwellings,and some of the older ones,use oil,mainly Kerosene,for domestic heating.
{ {Gas.}Although North Sea is piped to within a few miles of the village, there is no pipe line extension to Bishop Monkton.Bottled gas is used in some cases.
